name: Close-grip Press-ups
how_to_perform:
* Start in a plank position with your hands shoulder-width apart, but with them closer together than usual. To be specific, place your hands slightly more than shoulder-width, and directly under your chest. This will emphasize activation in the triceps.

* Position your body so that it forms a straight line from head to heels. Engage your core by pulling your belly button towards your spine.

* Lower your body by bending your elbows until they are at about a 45-degree angle or slightly more. Keep your shoulders down away from your ears and avoid scrunching up towards the ceiling with your collarbones.

* Continue lowering yourself in this way until your bottom is almost, but not quite touching the ground.

* Pause briefly to check that your form is correct and then push back up to the beginning position using a pressing motion. Think of straightening your arms as driving upward through them, using all of the muscles along your shoulders and chest to help you lift.
* Lower down with control and repeat the desired number of repetitions.
short_summary: Close-grip press-ups are a variation of traditional press-ups that primarily work the triceps and chest. This exercise places greater emphasis on these upper body muscles compared with a standard press-up.
